Deficiency Narrative: Staff member did not respond properly when youth-in-care requested alone time to speak.
Hand-washing sinks for Quad 4 and Quad 2 were not equipped with soap at the time of inspection.
The operation did not have all active child records immediately available for review and reproduction at the time of inspection.
Correction Narrative: The operation did not have all active child records immediately available for review and reproduction at the time of inspection.

Deficiency Narrative: Medication logs did not include names and signatures of those who administered daily medication.
Correction Narrative:
Operation is no longer operating since 7/5/23, follow up cannot be completed.

2nd email received from director 5/15/23: Updated MARS to include space for staff signatures.  
Email received from director on 5/12/23: Staff supervisors will document that they checked the MARS prior to coming off shift.

Deficiency Narrative: There were 3 children that had several missed doses of medication on multiple occasions.
Correction Narrative:
Operation is no longer operating since 7/5/23, follow up cannot be completed. 

2nd email received from director on 5/15/23: chart used to ensure medication refills are being done in a timely manner.
email received from director 5/12/23: When medication counts reach the last 10 doses the prescriberÂ’s office will be notified or the pharmacy if the medication can be refilled. A follow up request will be made at 5 days if the medication is not filled by that time.

Deficiency Narrative: Medication errors were not completed within 24 hours, as they were dated using a date range.
Correction Narrative:
Operation is no longer operating since 7/5/23, follow up cannot be completed.

Email received from director 5/12/22: All medication errors are documented appropriately on our medication error form and MAR.

Deficiency Narrative: Child's medical records showed that medication was not issued according to physicans orders.
Correction Narrative:
Follow-up inspection was conducted on 5/2/23 and action plan submitted was found to be implemented.  There were no concerns at this follow-up.
Action plan received from admin: A PRN medication log has been created and will be placed in the medication log which will track when PRN medication was given and the reason for it. Shift supervisors will be responsible for the notations.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of six beds on a pod were observed with no mattress covers or protectors.
Several pillows were observed to be stained and dirty.
Correction Narrative: Several pillows were observed to be stained and dirty.

Deficiency Narrative: Suicide screening was not conducted on new admission.
Correction Narrative: Suicide screening was not conducted on new admission.

Deficiency Narrative: 2 out of 3 child's files received were not signed.
Correction Narrative:
Response from administrator: PLSP have a checklist for signatures required prior to placing the file in the chart.  
Insp# 3938910 was conducted on 4/5/23.  The child record audit was created to ensure that all required signatures are being done.  I spoke to case manager which showed me all the  different worksheets that are being implemented to ensure that all signatures and documents are being completed.  She stated that the child record audit is ultimately the final record to ensure everything is being completed.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing employees files, one employee did not have a current drug test completed before having contact with youth in care.
Correction Narrative:
All employees who separate from the company for any reason for any length of time will be required to take and pass a drug test prior to having contact with youth in care.
A copy of employee's drug test was emailed and uploaded on sharepoint.

Deficiency Narrative: A contracted employee who provided therapy to youth in care,  did not have a Tuberculosis Test
Correction Narrative: On 10-11-22 The administrator submitted a CAP via email, in response to the citation, which is that all contractors who provide clinical services to the residents will be asked to show proof of negative TB test.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of Five medication blister packs were found to be inacurate according to the medication log.
Correction Narrative: On 10-11-22 the administrator submitted a response for the citation. All medication dispensing staff members will receive training on 10/12/22 regarding accurate count reporting and legibility of MARS information.

Deficiency Narrative: Two Serious Incident Reports depicting two different incidents on different dates, have the same wording verbatim. The reports were documented by different staff
Correction Narrative: On 10-11-22 the administrator submitted a response to address the citation. All incident reports will be reviewed by training a compliance personnel and a training will be done with all staff on 10/11/22 and 10/12/22. The training will relay the importance of documenting each serious incident event individually. As well as always completing the incident reports in a manner that only reflects the behaviors that occurred on the day of the event being documented.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation staff did not conduct an approved type of restraint on a child in care, when using a bear hug hold and walking restraint.
Correction Narrative:
On 11-04-22 the administrator submitted a response to the citation issued. Only approved restraints that are a part of CPI and Paloma Place Policy shall be used during EBI's. All guidelines set forth in the updated incident reports are to be followed. Trainings took place on 11-3-22 and 11-04-22.
On 4/13/23 follow-up insp#3940067 was conducted.  Interviews with staff and youth in care were conducted and no concerns were found over EBI.

Deficiency Narrative: Serious incident report did not give an accurate account of what occurred regarding a restraint. Statements made by staff do not align with documentation in the report.
Correction Narrative: On 12-28-22 for an inspection, the administrator submitted a response to the citation issued. A training occurred on 10-28-22 regarding incident report writing and the importance of accuracy.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was restrained in order to comply with directives, to surrender a prohibited item (cell phone), and enter the operation.
Correction Narrative: On 12/28/22 A inspection was done and the administrator submitted a response to the citation issued. Staff members will receive EBI refresher training in order to ensure that proper reasoning and use of restraints aligns with the guidelines of CPI and Paloma Place Policy. The trainings took place on 11-3-22 and 11-04-22.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was not displaying behaviors that required emergency intervention at the time of implementing the intervention or during continued interventions.
Correction Narrative:
On 11-04-22 the administrator submitted a response to the citation issued. Staff members will receive EBI refresher training in order to ensure that the child is a harm to himself or to others before a restraint may be performed. Trainings took place on 11-3-22 and 11-04-22.

On 4/13/23, follow-up inspection #3940067 was conducted.  Interviews were conducted with staff and youth in care, no concerns were noted.

Deficiency Narrative: The Incident Report did not list all witnesses present during a restraint.
Correction Narrative: The Incident Report did not list all witnesses present during a restraint.

Deficiency Narrative: The Incident Report did not include information on who observed the child after the restraint and after PRN medication was provided.
Correction Narrative: The Incident Report did not include information on who observed the child after the restraint and after PRN medication was provided.

Deficiency Narrative: An untrained caregiver used a restraint hold where a child's arm was placed behind their back while held against a wall.
Correction Narrative: An untrained caregiver used a restraint hold where a child's arm was placed behind their back while held against a wall.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff member left children under his care/ratio without direct supervision to assist with a restraint.
Correction Narrative:
Inspection#3921782: During interview with staff, it was stated that administration explained to them the procedures needed to ensure they are in always in ratio.  Staff stated that they are to always have a radio on them and there is a protocol of calling the supervisor in charge first and if additional help is needed, the supervisor will call for more staff.

Email from admin: Administrator explained that staff members will be called, and they will also be extra staff members to assist with supervision when needed.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care sustained a self-inflicted laceration to the head and injury to the hand.  Emergency medical treatment was obtained for the child on 8/24/2022.  The incident was not reported to Licensing as required.
Correction Narrative:
Inspection#3921782: During an interview with staff, it was stated that children are monitored 15-30 minutes after an injury occurs which at that time will be determined if the child needs medical attention.  It was stated that an SIR will be completed and a section was added to the SIR for notifications to ensure that the incident is reported to Licensing.  

Email Received from Administrator: Any substantial injury that requires medical attention will be reported no later than 24 hours after its occurrence.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver not trained in EBI was included in the implementation of a restraint of a child in care.
Correction Narrative:
Inspection#3921782: A list of EBI trained staff members was seen posted in the staff office in the quads.

Email from admin: A list of EBI trained staff members will be posted in the staff office as an advisory of who the shift supervisor can utilize during a physical crisis. The list will be located in the staff office in the quads. A copy of that list will be uploaded into the digital drive.

Deficiency Narrative: There was no documentation found in the child's file stating the child's parent was notified of an EBI.
Correction Narrative: There was no documentation found in the child's file stating the child's parent was notified of an EBI.

Deficiency Narrative: The initial Service Plan did not indicate who reviewed the plan with the youth in care and only the child's signature was obtained. It is important all team members provide signatures as required no later than the 15 days after the set date of the meeting to comply with minimum standards.
Correction Narrative:
The operation submitted a Corrective Action Plan. All service plan correspondence with DFPS will be tracked and multiple attempts will be noted and attached to service plan sections of the chart when signatures are not being pen and inked in person by the youthÂ’s DFPS worker.  

The Corrective Action Plan will be found in the digital drive.

Deficiency Narrative: During a walk-through of the operation a bed being used by one of the clients was found to be missing a mattress protector.
Correction Narrative: On 8/1/22 the Administrator sent a CAP via email in response to the citation. All mattresses are now inspected as a part of the daily environmental inspections completed by staff supervisors. In addition a copy of an Amazon order for a supply of mattress protectors were provided.

Deficiency Narrative: During a walk-through of the operation the kitchen area was observed. In the refrigerator there was  a package of Hash browns that was opened, it was not properly covered.
Correction Narrative: On 8/1/22 the Administrator submitted a CAP in response to the citation. All food handlers have been directed to ensure that all food is stored in a matter that aligns with the local health departmentÂ’s best practices and requirements.

Deficiency Narrative: There is information to support staff use profane language around and towards children in care.
Correction Narrative:
On 7/20/22 the administrator submitted a correction plan.  All staff have been informed of the citation and reminded to use appropriate language. Profane language towards a resident will resort in the employee being suspended or terminated. 
12/8/22 - in-person follow-up was conducted.  Inspector received copy of sign-in sheet for training that was conducted with staff.

Deficiency Narrative: In 1 of 4 child records, it was found that a Medication Administration Record did not have the time the medication was administered for 5 of 31 days in May 2022.
Correction Narrative: On 6/20/22 The administrator forwarded an email with a Correction plan to address the citation and bring the operation into compliance. Moving forward the Shift supervisor will inspect the MARS daily. The medication dispensing supervisor will inspect the MARS on a weekly basis and the Clinical Director will inspect the MARS on a Monthly basis to ensure accuracy.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing menus going back 90 days, food substitutions were not documented on the menus.
Correction Narrative: On 6/20/22 The administrator forwarded an email with a Correction plan to address the citation and bring the operation into compliance. Moving forward menus will have meal substitutes indicated on the daily menu calendar.

Deficiency Narrative: During a monitoring inspection a child in care was observed using a land line phone in the presence of two other children and one staff. The phone was located in a day room area were other children were watching TV. This did not allow for the child to have privacy.
Correction Narrative:
The Administrator provided their action plan in response to the citation. 
Staff members have been instructed to clear out the common area of other residents during phone calls and alternatively use the staff office as a location to make phone calls during non-prescribed phone call times. A meeting was also held with staff and a signature page was forwarded as proof.

Deficiency Narrative: The Administrator allowed a governing body member with restricted access to child file to be included in email communications regarding a child behaviors and information included in a child's record.
Correction Narrative: On 6/21/22 the Administrator submitted an action plan. All staff members have been instructed to not send any correspondence to Montray Johnson regarding information about the residents of Paloma Place RTC. The direction was given via email to all staff.

Deficiency Narrative: During the monitoring inspection 2 of 4 Serious Incident Reports were found to be missing full names for the staff.
Correction Narrative: The Administrator sent an email describing how they operation has addressed the citation. An email was sent to staff advising of the change to the SIR form. The staff were informed that full names are to be documented to identify the individuals involved in the incident.

Deficiency Narrative: Permit holder told a child in care to not participate in interviews with investigators.  The child did not participate in two interview attempts.
Correction Narrative: On 5/10/22 the Administrator forwarded via email an action plan to address the violation. A staff meeting and training session has been scheduled for all staff members both administrative and direct care for 05/10/22 and 05/13/22. Investigation cooperation will be discussed. A section regarding investigation cooperation will be added to the Paloma Place employee handbook and policies and procedures. All employees and residents are going to be encouraged to speak in a truthful manner when talking to investigators from any agency. All sign in sheets will be made available to inspectors.

Deficiency Narrative: 13 year old child in care was slapped by a caregiver and a 14 year old child was grabbed by the throat and slammed to the floor by the same caregiver.
Correction Narrative: On 5/10/22 the Administrator forwarded an action plan to address the violation: A staff meeting and training session has been scheduled for all staff members both administrative and direct care for 05/10/22 and 05/13/22. Paloma Place policies and procedures will be discussed, and an understanding of trauma informed care will be presented as well. On 05/09/22 all staff members on duty reviewed the policy on discipline and signed an acknowledgement form. All sign in sheets will be made available to inspectors. Form 7266 was sent out on 05/09/22 to all of the residentÂ’s guardians.

Deficiency Narrative: During a walk through of the operation it was observed that an  emergency evacuation and relocation diagram was not posted in a prominent and visible location.
Correction Narrative: During a walk through of the operation it was observed that an  emergency evacuation and relocation diagram was not posted in a prominent and visible location.

Deficiency Narrative: During a walk through of the operation. It was noticed that that several 2X2 railings were missing from a wooden stairway  leading to the recreational area.
Correction Narrative: During a walk through of the operation. It was noticed that that several 2X2 railings were missing from a wooden stairway  leading to the recreational area.

Deficiency Narrative:
During a walk through of the operation, two first aid kits were found to be missing items. one kit was missing a thermometer and the other a pair of scissors. 
NOTE:  No Action plan is required, the Deficiency was corrected at inspection.

During a review of  records it was found that a caregiver was missing CPR Certification and First Aid Certification documentation in the personnel file. A second caregiver was missing First Aid Certification documentation in their personnel file.
Correction Narrative: Program Manager,submitted a Corrective Action Plan to address the citation: Employee files reviewed have been updated to include staff current CPR/First Aid certification. An audit of employee files will be conducted by training staff regularly to ensure that training is in staff files in a timely manner. The documents have been uploaded in the digital storage.

Deficiency Narrative: During a review of personnel records a caregivers affidavit for employment was incomplete.
Correction Narrative:
Program Manager submitted a Corrective Action Plan to address the citation:  A discussion has been held with the notary explaining that affidavits must be completed in their entirety prior to receiving her stamp of approval. An audit of employee files will be completed by staff to ensure all documents in employee files are completed.
A copy of the corrected 2985 was also provided. The documents have been uploaded to digital storage.
